articles.author: Jonathan Saul, Simon Lewis
articles.description: Ruth Lieberman, a Jewish settler in the Israeli occupied West Bank, is determined to thwart international pressure for a sovereign Palestinian state. And her friendships with prominent U.S. Republicans from the party's religious right are helping, she says.
articles.title: Israeli settlers court Republican religious right after Hamas attacks

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: Donald Trump will hold his first campaign rally on Saturday since he narrowly escaped an assassination attempt one week ago and fresh from his nominating convention where his takeover of the Republican Party was cemented.
articles.title: Trump to hold first campaign rally after assassination attempt

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: One of the world's youngest air forces is taking part in war games alongside cutting-edge stealth fighter jets as the Pacific Island nation of Papua New Guinea boosts defence ties with Australia and the United States.
articles.title: World's youngest air force Papua New Guinea takes to skies among Top Guns

articles.author: Sam Jahan
articles.description: Bangladesh soldiers patrolled Dhaka's deserted streets on Saturday amid a curfew to quell deadly students-led protests against government job quotas that have killed more than 100 people this week.
articles.title: Bangladesh army enforces curfew as student-led protests spiral

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Xi Jinping urged all-out rescue efforts after a highway bridge collapse on Friday in Shaanxi province in China's northwest killed 11 people, state media reported on Saturday.
articles.title: China's Xi urges all-out rescue efforts after highway bridge collapse kills 11

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Air raid sirens wailed across Cyprus's ethnically-split capital Nicosia at dawn on Saturday as Greek Cypriots mourned, and Turkish Cypriots celebrated 50 years since Turkey invaded part of the island in response to a brief Greek-inspired coup.
articles.title: One part mourns, another celebrates as Cyprus marks 50 years since split

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia increased imports tariffs for consumer goods, including wine, beer, candies, biscuits and shampoo, produced in countries that support sanctions against Moscow, according to a government order published late on Friday.
articles.title: Russia hikes import tariffs for consumer goods from 'unfriendly countries'

articles.author: Nobuhiro Kubo, Tim Kelly
articles.description: A U.S. plan to use Japanese factories to boost production of Patriot air defence missiles - used by Ukraine to defend against Russian attacks - is being delayed by a shortage of a critical component manufactured by Boeing, four sources said.
articles.title: Exclusive: US-Japan Patriot missile production plan hits Boeing component roadblock

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Major U.S. airlines ordered ground stops on Friday citing communications issues, while other carriers, media companies, banks and telecoms firms around the world also reported system outages were disrupting their operations.
articles.title: Global cyber outage grounds flights and disrupts businesses

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three pro-Russian hackers have been arrested for alleged cyberattacks against Spain and other NATO countries for terrorist purposes, Spanish police said on Saturday.
articles.title: Three 'pro-Russian' hackers arrested in Spain over cyberattacks
